result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rafael Elroy Garay

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 13, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Phone call to Alisha/Atty Petrouske and Jordan/DA's office rescheduled the Sentencing that was set on 12/21/2022 at 1pm to 1/13/2022 at 10am. This was rescheduled because Atty Petrouske has just taken over the case.
Sentencing hearing on December 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:00 PM Court calls 21CF92, 21CF185, 22CF4 Defendant Rafael Elroy Garay in court, in custody.  Attorney Maggie R Crawford in court for Rafael Elroy Garay. Attorney Amy  Pautzke in court for State of Wisconsin.   Atty. Crawford will be taking a job w/Brown County DA Office.  Deft. consents that Atty. Crawford remain for Plea Hearing and Att. Petrousek will handle the SEH.  Deft. is in agreement.  Atty. Pautzke moves to amend information to offense date on the record.  No objection from defense.  Plea offer filed w/the court dated 10/26/22 reviewed.  22CF4 Ct. 1 of Information reviewed and Deft. enters a NO CONTEST Plea.  Ct. 2 of Information reviewed and Deft. enters a NO CONTEST Plea.  Plea quest. & waiver of rights/elements reviewed.  Voting/Firearms.  Court finds plea made freely & voluntarily.  Court accepts plea and Deft. is adjudged guilty in 22CF4 Ct. 1 & 2 and orders a JOC entered into the record.  PSI Ordered.  Cases 21CF92 Ct. 1, 2, 3 and 21CF185 Ct. 1 are DRI.  PBC.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:00 AM Defendant Rafael Elroy Garay in court, in custody.  Attorney Maggie R Crawford in court for Rafael Elroy Garay.  Prosecuting attorney Amy R. Greenwood Pautzke in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Active negotiations with DA.  Schedule for anticipated Pleah Hearing.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on September 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:13 AM Defendant Rafael Elroy Garay in court with attorney Jon G Spansail.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  He would like to hire private counsel.  Court allows Atty. Spansail to withdraw.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Rafael Elroy Garay in court with attorney Jon G Spansail.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information received.  Waive reading.  NG plea entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

PQW received/reviewed by Court. Court finds waiver to be made freely and voluntarily. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed by this defendant and is bound over to the circuit court. Present bond cont'd.

09:41 AM Defendant Rafael Elroy Garay in court with attorney Jon G Spansail.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reconvene 9:37 appearance by deft.  Bench warrants canceled, bonds restored.  Arraignment scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:28 AM Attorney Jon G Spansail in court.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Non appearance by deft. Court waits another 2 minutes for deft to arrive.  9:30 BWA.  Bonds revoked.

records.addlTxt: 10:25 AM Defendant Rafael Elroy Garay in court with attorney Jon G Spansail.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PH waive time limits.  May have contact with mother/father.  No violent contact.  Bond to be amended.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

w/condition Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages.  Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license. Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.

01:00 PM Defendant Rafael Elroy Garay in court, in custody.  Lisa Rowe for DA Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rafael Elroy Garay appeared by video means.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, and advised of right to counsel/SPD.   Bond is set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
